dialogue_turns.speaker: Narrator
dialogue_turns.text: Millions of tons of goods move across the vast steppes of Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Millions of tons of goods move across the vast steppes of Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Kazakhstan is really pushing to become the logistics hub of the Eurasian Economic Union, you know, the EAEU.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Kazakhstan is really pushing to become the logistics hub of the Eurasian Economic Union, you know, the E A E U.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan intends to position itself as a logistics hub of the Eurasian Economic Union (EAEU) and act as a center for cooperation development, considering its geography, the Ministry of Trade and Integration told RIA Novosti.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and it makes a ton of sense given their geography. They're, uh, the largest landlocked country in that union.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and it makes a ton of sense given their geography. They're, uh, the largest landlocked country in that union.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the same time, the ministry noted that Kazakhstan is the largest landlocked country in the EAEU, and within the union, there are commitments to provide Kazakhstani carriers with domestic railway tariffs toward seaports (mainly Taman, Ust-Luga, and others), which help reduce financial costs for Kazakhstani businesses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And they're actively developing those key transport corridors—the East-West and North-South routes, plus the Trans-Caspian one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And they're actively developing those key transport corridors-the East-West and North-South routes, plus the Trans-Caspian one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For this purpose, active work is underway to develop transport infrastructure along the 'East"West', 'North"South' directions, as well as the Trans-Caspian International Transport Route," the ministry said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is huge, right? Because being landlocked is such a challenge for trade.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is huge, right? Because being landlocked is such a challenge for trade.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. But they've got this interesting support system within the EAEU too. Like, uh, domestic railway tariffs for their carriers heading to seaports.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. But they've got this interesting support system within the E A E U too. Like, uh, domestic railway tariffs for their carriers heading to seaports.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the same time, the ministry noted that Kazakhstan is the largest landlocked country in the EAEU, and within the union, there are commitments to provide Kazakhstani carriers with domestic railway tariffs toward seaports (mainly Taman, Ust-Luga, and others), which help reduce financial costs for Kazakhstani businesses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, like Taman and Ust-Luga. That's gotta help lower costs for Kazakh businesses significantly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, like Taman and Ust-Luga. That's gotta help lower costs for Kazakh businesses significantly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the same time, the ministry noted that Kazakhstan is the largest landlocked country in the EAEU, and within the union, there are commitments to provide Kazakhstani carriers with domestic railway tariffs toward seaports (mainly Taman, Ust-Luga, and others), which help reduce financial costs for Kazakhstani businesses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And the funding mechanism is pretty clever—it comes from 10% of the anti-dumping duties collected by all EAEU members.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And the funding mechanism is pretty clever-it comes from ten percent of the anti-dumping duties collected by all E A E U members.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the Ministry of Trade, funding is provided through 10 percent of the total revenue from anti-dumping duties collected by EAEU member states.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, so it's like recycling those funds back into infrastructure. How much are we talking per project?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, so it's like recycling those funds back into infrastructure. How much are we talking per project?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The max subsidy is 1.7 billion tenge per year, which is about 3.3 million dollars.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The max subsidy is one point seven billion tenge per year, which is about three point three million dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The maximum subsidy for one project is 1.7 billion tenge ($3.3 million) per year, which will amount to approximately 87 billion tenge ($169.1 million) over five years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And over five years, that adds up to nearly 87 billion tenge. That's a serious investment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And over five years, that adds up to nearly eighty seven billion tenge. That's a serious investment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The maximum subsidy for one project is 1.7 billion tenge ($3.3 million) per year, which will amount to approximately 87 billion tenge ($169.1 million) over five years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. They're not just building roads and rails; they're positioning themselves as a center for cooperation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. They're not just building roads and rails; they're positioning themselves as a center for cooperation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "Kazakhstan, taking into account its geography and capabilities, aims to act as a center for cooperation development," the ministry added.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Turning a geographical challenge into a strategic advantage. You gotta admire that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Turning a geographical challenge into a strategic advantage. You gotta admire that.
